alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 12:38AM CST until January 02 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Galveston. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways resulting in stalled vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past three hours, and moderate to heavy rain continues within the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches per hour are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... League City, Galveston Island West End, Galveston Causeway, Texas City, Alvin, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, southern Seabrook, Webster, Hitchcock, Kemah, Galveston Pier 21, Nassau Bay, Bayou Vista, Clear Lake Shores, Jamaica Beach, Tiki Island, Hillcrest and Liverpool. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
